intro: Myrsine potama, commonly known as the swamp myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific Islands. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a glossy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are usually white or pale pink in color.
